citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC), National Marine Mammal Laboratory (NMML)
citeinfo.title: Estimates of Food Consumption by Marine Mammals in the Eastern Bering Sea

abstract.p: Report on food consumption estimates by marine mammals in the eastern Bering Sea. The study used available data on marine mammal diets and feeding rates to estimate food consumption by marine mammals. In addition, the biomass of fish consumed annually by marine mammals in the eastern Bering Sea is estimated for comparison with commerical fish catches.
[Reference: Perez, M. A., and W. B. McAlister. 1993. Estimates of food consumption by marine mammals in the Eastern Bering Sea. U.S. Dep. Commer., NOAA Tech. Memo. NMFS-AFSC-14, 36 p.]

descript.purpose: To estimate the total amount of food consumed by all marine mammal populations in the Bering Sea.
